You said:
whats the procedure for railway reservation system
ChatGPT said:

The procedure for a railway reservation system (in most countries, including India and others with structured rail networks) typically involves several steps, whether you're booking online or at a reservation counter. Below is a general breakdown:

✅ 1. Choose Your Travel Details

You need to know:

  • From (Departure Station)

  • To (Arrival Station)

  • Date of Journey

  • Class of Travel (e.g., Sleeper, AC 3-Tier, AC Chair Car, etc.)

  • Train Preference (optional)

✅ 2. Check Train Availability

Using:

  • Online platforms (like IRCTC in India, Amtrak in the US, or DB in Germany)

  • Railway reservation counters

  • Mobile apps

You check:

  • Train timings

  • Seat/berth availability

  • Fare

✅ 3. Make the Reservation

Online Booking Process:

  1. Log in to the official railway website or app.

  2. Enter travel details.

  3. Select train and class.

  4. Enter passenger information:

    • Name

    • Age

    • Gender

    • ID details (sometimes)

  5. Choose berth preference (optional).

  6. Confirm availability and fare.

  7. Make payment via:

    • Credit/debit card

    • Net banking

    • UPI/wallets (India)

  8. Receive e-ticket via email/SMS.

Offline Booking Process (at a counter):

  1. Fill out a reservation form with:

    • Train details

    • Passenger names and ages

  2. Submit it at the reservation counter.

  3. Make payment (cash/card).

  4. Receive a printed ticket.

✅ 4. Ticket Types

  • Confirmed: Seat/berth is allotted.

  • RAC (Reservation Against Cancellation): Shared berth, upgraded if someone cancels.

  • WL (Waitlist): No seat, upgraded only if cancellations happen.

✅ 5. On the Day of Travel

  • Carry a valid ID (for online tickets).

  • For e-tickets, no printout is needed—just the SMS/email + ID.

  • Arrive early and check platform information.

✅ Optional Services

  • Tatkal Booking: Emergency booking (higher price, opens a day before journey).

  • Special Quotas: Senior citizens, ladies, military, etc.

Would you like a flowchart, a use case for a system design, or help coding a simplified version of this system in Python or another language?

✅ Reservation Flow Required:

  1. Ask user for:

    • Train ID

    • Travel Date

    • Class (Sleeper / 3rd-AC / 2nd-AC)

    • Number of seats

  2. Check seat availability in seats table:

    • If seats available: Confirm booking, reduce seat count

    • If not: Add to Waiting List

  3. Allow cancelation:

    • Increase seat count

✅ C# Implementation: Reservation Function

Insert the following under BusinessLogic inside the else if (ans == 2) block (i.e., "Make Reservation").

🔧 MakeReservation() Method:

csharp
public void MakeReservation()
{
    Console.WriteLine("-------- Ticket Reservation --------");
    
    Console.Write("Enter Train ID: ");
    int trainId = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());

    Console.Write("Enter Travel Date (yyyy-mm-dd): ");
    DateTime travelDate = DateTime.Parse(Console.ReadLine());

    Console.Write("Enter Class (Sleeper / 3rd-AC / 2nd-AC): ");
    string travelClass = Console.ReadLine();

    Console.Write("Enter Number of Seats: ");
    int seatCount = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());

    int availableSeats = DataAccess.GetAvailableSeats(trainId, travelDate, travelClass);

    if (availableSeats >= seatCount)
    {
        // Confirm Booking
        bool booked = DataAccess.ConfirmBooking(BusinessLogic.UserName, trainId, travelDate, travelClass, seatCount);
        if (booked)
            Console.WriteLine("Booking Confirmed!");
    }
    else
    {
        // Add to Waiting List
        bool waiting = DataAccess.AddToWaitingList(BusinessLogic.UserName, trainId, travelDate, travelClass, seatCount);
        if (waiting)
            Console.WriteLine("Seats Not Available. You have been added to the Waiting List.");
    }

    Console.WriteLine("Press Any Key to Return to Dashboard.");
    Console.ReadKey();
}

🔧 DataAccess Methods:

Add these to DataAccess class:

✅ Get Available Seats

csharp
public static int GetAvailableSeats(int trainId, DateTime date, string travelClass)
{
    int seats = 0;
    try
    {
        con = getConnection();
        cmd = new SqlCommand("SELECT AvailableSeats FROM Seats WHERE TrainID = @tid AND TravelDate = @tdate AND Class = @tclass", con);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@tid", trainId);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@tdate", date);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@tclass", travelClass);
        object result = cmd.ExecuteScalar();

        if (result != null)
            seats = Convert.ToInt32(result);
    }
    catch (SqlException ex)
    {
        Console.WriteLine(ex.Message);
    }
    return seats;
}

✅ Confirm Booking + Update Seats

csharp
public static bool ConfirmBooking(string username, int trainId, DateTime date, string travelClass, int seatCount)
{
    try
    {
        con = getConnection();

        // 1. Insert booking
        cmd = new SqlCommand("INSERT INTO Bookings(UserName, TrainID, TravelDate, Class, SeatsBooked, Status) " +
                             "VALUES(@uname, @tid, @tdate, @class, @seats, 'Confirmed')", con);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@uname", username);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@tid", trainId);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@tdate", date);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@class", travelClass);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@seats", seatCount);
        cmd.ExecuteNonQuery();

        // 2. Update seats
        cmd = new SqlCommand("UPDATE Seats SET AvailableSeats = AvailableSeats - @seats " +
                             "WHERE TrainID = @tid AND TravelDate = @tdate AND Class = @class", con);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@seats", seatCount);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@tid", trainId);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@tdate", date);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@class", travelClass);
        cmd.ExecuteNonQuery();

        return true;
    }
    catch (SqlException ex)
    {
        Console.WriteLine(ex.Message);
        return false;
    }
}

✅ Add to Waiting List

csharp

        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@tdate", date);

        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@seats", seatCount);
        cmd.ExecuteNonQuery();

        return true;

    catch (SqlException ex)

        return false;

✅ Optional Feature: Promote from Waiting List After Cancelation

When a user cancels a booking:

  • Increase the AvailableSeats

  • Check WaitingList (same train/date/class)

  • If someone is waiting, and enough seats available → move them to Bookings, delete from WaitingList

Here’s how:

🔧 PromoteFromWaitingList() — C# Logic (add to DataAccess)

csharp
public static void PromoteFromWaitingList(int trainId, DateTime date, string travelClass)
{
    try
    {
        con = getConnection();

        // Step 1: Get first waiting user (FIFO)
        cmd = new SqlCommand(@"SELECT TOP 1 * FROM WaitingList 
                               WHERE TrainID = @tid AND TravelDate = @tdate AND Class = @class
                               ORDER BY RequestTime", con);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@tid", trainId);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@tdate", date);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@class", travelClass);

        SqlDataReader reader = cmd.ExecuteReader();

        if (reader.Read())
        {
            string user = reader["UserName"].ToString();
            int seatsRequested = Convert.ToInt32(reader["SeatsRequested"]);
            int waitingId = Convert.ToInt32(reader["WaitingID"]);

            reader.Close();

            // Step 2: Check current available seats
            int availableSeats = GetAvailableSeats(trainId, date, travelClass);

            if (availableSeats >= seatsRequested)
            {
                // Step 3: Confirm booking
                ConfirmBooking(user, trainId, date, travelClass, seatsRequested);

                // Step 4: Remove from waiting list
                cmd = new SqlCommand("DELETE FROM WaitingList WHERE WaitingID = @wid", con);
                cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@wid", waitingId);
                cmd.ExecuteNonQuery();

                Console.WriteLine($"User '{user}' promoted from waiting list and booking confirmed!");
            }
        }
    }
    catch (SqlException ex)
    {
        Console.WriteLine("Error during waiting list promotion: " + ex.Message);
    }
}

ChatGPT said:

Excellent thinking — you're now touching on concurrency, fair allocation, and partial promotions from the waiting list — this takes your project to a real-world level.

Let’s break it all down and solve it step by step.

✅ Problem Summary

  1. ✔️ One user can book up to 6 seats

  2. ✔️ One user can cancel 1 or more seats

  3. ✔️ Waiting list promotion should be smart:

    • If 1 seat is canceled, promote the user who is waiting for 1

    • If more seats are canceled, promote users in FIFO (first-come-first-serve) order, partially if possible

    • Remaining seats stay in waiting list

  4. ❓ Multiple users accessing at the same time:

    • Requires transactions + locking (optional for mini-project, but you can simulate it)

✅ Let's Design The Behavior

🎯 Booking Rules:

  • One booking = One record in the Bookings table

  • One user can make multiple bookings (e.g., 2 + 3 + 1 = 6 seats max)

🎯 Cancellation Rules:

  • When cancelling n seats, increase AvailableSeats by n

  • Then, check the waiting list ordered by RequestTime

  • Promote as many waiting requests as possible:

    • Exact match first

    • Then partially fulfill a request (e.g., someone requested 4 seats, only 2 are available → promote 2, keep 2 in wait)

🧠 Tables (Recap)

We already have:

✅ Bookings

✅ Full Solution: Smart Waiting List Promotion (with Partial Handling)

🔧 C# Method: PromoteFromWaitingList(int trainId, DateTime date, string travelClass)

This handles:

  • Partial promotions

  • Multiple users in queue

csharp
public static void PromoteFromWaitingList(int trainId, DateTime date, string travelClass)
{
    try
    {
        con = getConnection();

        // Get available seats
        int availableSeats = GetAvailableSeats(trainId, date, travelClass);

        if (availableSeats == 0)
            return;

        // Step 1: Get all users in waiting list (FIFO)
        cmd = new SqlCommand(@"SELECT * FROM WaitingList 
                               WHERE TrainID = @tid AND TravelDate = @tdate AND Class = @class
                               ORDER BY RequestTime", con);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@tid", trainId);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@tdate", date);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@class", travelClass);

        SqlDataReader reader = cmd.ExecuteReader();

        List<(int WaitingID, string UserName, int SeatsRequested)> waitlist = new List<(int, string, int)>();

        while (reader.Read())
        {
            waitlist.Add((
                Convert.ToInt32(reader["WaitingID"]),
                reader["UserName"].ToString(),
                Convert.ToInt32(reader["SeatsRequested"])
            ));
        }

        reader.Close();

        foreach (var entry in waitlist)
        {
            if (availableSeats == 0) break;

            int seatsToPromote = Math.Min(availableSeats, entry.SeatsRequested);

            // 1. Confirm booking with available seats
            ConfirmBooking(entry.UserName, trainId, date, travelClass, seatsToPromote);

            // 2. Update available seats
            availableSeats -= seatsToPromote;

            // 3. If partial promotion, update WaitingList
            if (seatsToPromote < entry.SeatsRequested)
            {
                cmd = new SqlCommand("UPDATE WaitingList SET SeatsRequested = SeatsRequested - @promoted WHERE WaitingID = @wid", con);
                cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@promoted", seatsToPromote);
                cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@wid", entry.WaitingID);
                cmd.ExecuteNonQuery();
            }
            else
            {
                // Full promotion, delete from waiting list
                cmd = new SqlCommand("DELETE FROM WaitingList WHERE WaitingID = @wid", con);
                cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@wid", entry.WaitingID);
                cmd.ExecuteNonQuery();
            }

            Console.WriteLine($"Promoted {entry.UserName} from waiting list for {seatsToPromote} seat(s).");
        }

        // Update available seats in database
        cmd = new SqlCommand("UPDATE Seats SET AvailableSeats = @seats WHERE TrainID = @tid AND TravelDate = @tdate AND Class = @class", con);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@seats", availableSeats);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@tid", trainId);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@tdate", date);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@class", travelClass);
        cmd.ExecuteNonQuery();
    }
    catch (SqlException ex)
    {
        Console.WriteLine("Error during waiting list promotion: " + ex.Message);
    }
}

✅ C# Cancellation Logic

🔧 CancelSeats(string userName, int trainId, DateTime date, string travelClass, int cancelSeats)

csharp
public static void CancelSeats(string userName, int trainId, DateTime date, string travelClass, int cancelSeats)
{
    try
    {
        con = getConnection();

        // 1. Find bookings of the user to cancel from
        cmd = new SqlCommand(@"SELECT TOP 1 * FROM Bookings 
                               WHERE UserName = @uname AND TrainID = @tid 
                               AND TravelDate = @tdate AND Class = @class 
                               AND SeatsBooked >= @cancelSeats
                               ORDER BY BookingTime", con);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@uname", userName);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@tid", trainId);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@tdate", date);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@class", travelClass);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@cancelSeats", cancelSeats);

        SqlDataReader reader = cmd.ExecuteReader();

        if (reader.Read())
        {
            int bookingId = Convert.ToInt32(reader["BookingID"]);
            int currentSeats = Convert.ToInt32(reader["SeatsBooked"]);
            reader.Close();

            if (cancelSeats == currentSeats)
            {
                // Full cancel
                cmd = new SqlCommand("DELETE FROM Bookings WHERE BookingID = @bid", con);
                cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@bid", bookingId);
                cmd.ExecuteNonQuery();
            }
            else
            {
                // Partial cancel
                cmd = new SqlCommand("UPDATE Bookings SET SeatsBooked = SeatsBooked - @cancel WHERE BookingID = @bid", con);
                cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@cancel", cancelSeats);
                cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@bid", bookingId);
                cmd.ExecuteNonQuery();
            }

            // 2. Increase available seats
            cmd = new SqlCommand("UPDATE Seats SET AvailableSeats = AvailableSeats + @cancel " +
                                 "WHERE TrainID = @tid AND TravelDate = @tdate AND Class = @class", con);
            cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@cancel", cancelSeats);
            cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@tid", trainId);
            cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@tdate", date);
            cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@class", travelClass);
            cmd.ExecuteNonQuery();

            Console.WriteLine("Cancellation successful.");

            // 3. Trigger promotion
            PromoteFromWaitingList(trainId, date, travelClass);
        }
        else
        {
            Console.WriteLine("No matching booking found for cancellation.");
        }
    }
    catch (SqlException ex)
    {
        Console.WriteLine("Error during cancellation: " + ex.Message);
    }
}

🛡️ Handling Multiple Users (Concurrency)

You can add the following protections later:

  • Use SqlTransaction to wrap seat updates and inserts to ensure atomicity.

  • Add a check for AvailableSeats >= SeatsRequested just before promotion inside the transaction.

But for your mini project, this is optional unless you’re running multi-threaded simulations.

    TrainID INT,

    TotalSeats INT,
    BookingTime DATETIME DEFAULT GETDATE()
);

This way:

  • You can query by individual (PassengerBookings) or group (BookingSummary)

👨‍💻 C# FLOW: BOOKING FOR MULTIPLE PASSENGERS

csharp
public static void MakeGroupBooking(string userName)
{
    Console.Write("Enter Train ID: ");
    int trainId = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());

    Console.Write("Enter Travel Date (yyyy-mm-dd): ");
    DateTime date = Convert.ToDateTime(Console.ReadLine());

    Console.Write("Enter Class (Sleeper / 3rd-AC / 2nd-AC): ");
    string travelClass = Console.ReadLine();

    Console.Write("Enter Number of Tickets (Max 6): ");
    int ticketCount = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());

    if (ticketCount < 1 || ticketCount > 6)
    {
        Console.WriteLine("Invalid ticket count. Max 6 allowed.");
        return;
    }

    int availableSeats = GetAvailableSeats(trainId, date, travelClass);
    if (availableSeats < ticketCount)
    {
        Console.WriteLine("Not enough seats. Adding to waiting list.");
        AddToWaitingList(userName, trainId, date, travelClass, ticketCount);
        return;
    }

    // Insert into BookingSummary
    int bookingId = InsertBookingSummary(userName, trainId, date, travelClass, ticketCount);

    for (int i = 1; i <= ticketCount; i++)
    {
        Console.WriteLine($"\nEnter details for Passenger {i}:");

        Console.Write("Name: ");
        string name = Console.ReadLine();

        Console.Write("Age: ");
        int age = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());

        Console.Write("Gender (M/F): ");
        string gender = Console.ReadLine();

        InsertPassenger(bookingId, userName, trainId, date, travelClass, name, age, gender);
    }

    // Update seats
    UpdateSeatCount(trainId, date, travelClass, -ticketCount);

    Console.WriteLine($"Booking Confirmed! Booking ID: {bookingId}");
}

🔧 Helper Methods You’ll Need

csharp
public static int InsertBookingSummary(string userName, int trainId, DateTime date, string travelClass, int totalSeats)
{
    cmd = new SqlCommand("INSERT INTO BookingSummary (UserName, TrainID, TravelDate, Class, TotalSeats) " +
                         "OUTPUT INSERTED.BookingID " +
                         "VALUES (@uname, @tid, @date, @class, @seats)", con);
    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@uname", userName);
    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@tid", trainId);
    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@date", date);
    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@class", travelClass);
    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@seats", totalSeats);

    return (int)cmd.ExecuteScalar();
}

public static void InsertPassenger(int bookingId, string userName, int trainId, DateTime date, string travelClass, string passengerName, int age, string gender)
{
    cmd = new SqlCommand("INSERT INTO PassengerBookings (BookingID, UserName, TrainID, TravelDate, Class, PassengerName, Age, Gender) " +
                         "VALUES (@bid, @uname, @tid, @date, @class, @pname, @age, @gender)", con);
    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@bid", bookingId);
    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@uname", userName);
    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@tid", trainId);
    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@date", date);
    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@class", travelClass);
    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@pname", passengerName);
    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@age", age);
    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@gender", gender);

    cmd.ExecuteNonQuery();
}

❌ CANCEL A SINGLE PASSENGER

csharp
public static void CancelPassengerTicket(string userName)
{
    Console.Write("Enter Train ID: ");
    int trainId = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());

    Console.Write("Enter Travel Date (yyyy-mm-dd): ");
    DateTime date = Convert.ToDateTime(Console.ReadLine());

    Console.Write("Enter Class: ");
    string travelClass = Console.ReadLine();

    Console.Write("Enter Passenger Name to Cancel: ");
    string passengerName = Console.ReadLine();

    // Check if the passenger exists
    cmd = new SqlCommand(@"SELECT TOP 1 * FROM PassengerBookings 
                           WHERE UserName = @uname AND TrainID = @tid AND TravelDate = @date 
                           AND Class = @class AND PassengerName = @pname", con);
    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@uname", userName);
    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@tid", trainId);
    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@date", date);
    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@class", travelClass);
    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@pname", passengerName);

    SqlDataReader reader = cmd.ExecuteReader();

    if (!reader.HasRows)
    {
        reader.Close();
        Console.WriteLine("No such passenger found.");
        return;
    }

    reader.Read();
    int bookingId = Convert.ToInt32(reader["BookingID"]);
    reader.Close();

    // Delete passenger
    cmd = new SqlCommand("DELETE FROM PassengerBookings WHERE PassengerName = @pname AND BookingID = @bid", con);
    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@pname", passengerName);
    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@bid", bookingId);
    cmd.ExecuteNonQuery();

    // Decrease seat count from summary
    cmd = new SqlCommand("UPDATE BookingSummary SET TotalSeats = TotalSeats - 1 WHERE BookingID = @bid", con);
    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@bid", bookingId);
    cmd.ExecuteNonQuery();

    // Update available seats
    UpdateSeatCount(trainId, date, travelClass, +1);

    Console.WriteLine($"Passenger '{passengerName}' canceled successfully.");

    // Trigger waitlist promotion
    PromoteFromWaitingList(trainId, date, travelClass);
}

🛠️ Updated C# Method for Multi-Passenger Cancellation

csharp
public static void CancelMultiplePassengers(string userName)
{
    Console.WriteLine("---------- Cancel Booking ----------");

    Console.Write("Enter Train ID: ");
    int trainId = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());

    Console.Write("Enter Travel Date (yyyy-mm-dd): ");
    DateTime travelDate = Convert.ToDateTime(Console.ReadLine());

    Console.Write("Enter Class (Sleeper / 3rd-AC / 2nd-AC): ");
    string travelClass = Console.ReadLine();

    Console.Write("Enter Number of Passengers to Cancel: ");
    int cancelCount = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());

    if (cancelCount <= 0)
    {
        Console.WriteLine("Invalid number of passengers to cancel.");
        return;
    }

    List<string> passengerNames = new List<string>();

    for (int i = 1; i <= cancelCount; i++)
    {
        Console.Write($"Enter Name of Passenger {i} to Cancel: ");
        passengerNames.Add(Console.ReadLine());
    }

    int successfulCancellations = 0;

    foreach (string name in passengerNames)
    {
        // Find the passenger
        cmd = new SqlCommand(@"SELECT TOP 1 BookingID FROM PassengerBookings 
                               WHERE UserName = @uname AND TrainID = @tid AND TravelDate = @date 
                               AND Class = @class AND PassengerName = @pname", con);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@uname", userName);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@tid", trainId);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@date", travelDate);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@class", travelClass);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@pname", name);

        object result = cmd.ExecuteScalar();

        if (result != null)
        {
            int bookingId = Convert.ToInt32(result);

            // Delete passenger
            SqlCommand del = new SqlCommand(@"DELETE FROM PassengerBookings 
                                              WHERE BookingID = @bid AND PassengerName = @pname", con);
            del.Parameters.AddWithValue("@bid", bookingId);
            del.Parameters.AddWithValue("@pname", name);
            del.ExecuteNonQuery();

            // Update total seats in summary
            SqlCommand upd = new SqlCommand(@"UPDATE BookingSummary 
                                              SET TotalSeats = TotalSeats - 1 
                                              WHERE BookingID = @bid", con);
            upd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@bid", bookingId);
            upd.ExecuteNonQuery();

            // Update available seats in seats table
            UpdateSeatCount(trainId, travelDate, travelClass, +1);

            successfulCancellations++;
        }
        else
        {
            Console.WriteLine($"Passenger '{name}' not found or already cancelled.");
        }
    }

    if (successfulCancellations > 0)
    {
        Console.WriteLine($"{successfulCancellations} passenger(s) cancelled successfully.");
        PromoteFromWaitingList(trainId, travelDate, travelClass); // optional
    }
    else
    {
        Console.WriteLine("No passengers were cancelled.");
    }
}

🔄 Support Method – Update Seat Count

csharp
public static void UpdateSeatCount(int trainId, DateTime date, string travelClass, int delta)
{
    SqlCommand cmd = new SqlCommand(@"UPDATE seats 
                                      SET AvailableSeats = AvailableSeats + @delta 
                                      WHERE TrainID = @tid AND TravelDate = @date AND Class = @class", con);
    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@delta", delta);
    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@tid", trainId);
    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@date", date);
    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@class", travelClass);
    cmd.ExecuteNonQuery();
}

🧠 Waiting List Promotion (Basic Logic)

Here’s a simplified version of the waiting list promotion logic:

csharp
public static void PromoteFromWaitingList(int trainId, DateTime date, string travelClass)
{
    int availableSeats = GetAvailableSeats(trainId, date, travelClass);

    if (availableSeats == 0)
        return;

    // Example query - you can extend this with a proper priority system
    SqlCommand cmd = new SqlCommand(@"SELECT TOP 1 WaitingID, UserName, SeatsRequested 
                                      FROM WaitingList 
                                      WHERE TrainID = @tid AND TravelDate = @date AND Class = @class 
                                      ORDER BY SeatsRequested", con);

    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@tid", trainId);
    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@date", date);
    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@class", travelClass);

    SqlDataReader reader = cmd.ExecuteReader();

    while (reader.Read() && availableSeats > 0)
    {
        int seatsRequested = Convert.ToInt32(reader["SeatsRequested"]);
        string waitUser = reader["UserName"].ToString();
        int waitId = Convert.ToInt32(reader["WaitingID"]);

        if (availableSeats >= seatsRequested)
        {
            Console.WriteLine($"User '{waitUser}' promoted from waiting list for {seatsRequested} seat(s).");

            // Perform booking logic for waitUser (reuse your booking code)
            // Remove from waiting list
            reader.Close();

            SqlCommand del = new SqlCommand("DELETE FROM WaitingList WHERE WaitingID = @wid", con);
            del.Parameters.AddWithValue("@wid", waitId);
            del.ExecuteNonQuery();

            UpdateSeatCount(trainId, date, travelClass, -seatsRequested);
            availableSeats -= seatsRequested;
        }
        else
        {
            reader.Read();
        }
    }

    reader.Close();
}

🔁 Scenario Recap

Initial State

  • User 2 logs in → books 2 tickets → added to waiting list

Later…

    • System should:

      • ✅ Cancel those 2 specific tickets

      • ✅ Increase available seats

      • ✅ Check waiting list

      • ✅ Promote User 2’s 2 waiting tickets to confirmed

  • When User 2 logs in again and checks booking:

    • ✅ Should see those 2 tickets are now confirmed

✅ How to Make This Work

To achieve this, we need:

✅ 1. Booking Table Enhancements

Use PassengerBookings table with a new column:

sql
ALTER TABLE PassengerBookings ADD Status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'Confirmed';
-- Possible values: 'Confirmed', 'Waiting'

So each passenger record now has:

  • PassengerID

  • BookingID

  • UserName

  • TrainID

  • Class

  • PassengerName

  • Status → 'Confirmed' or 'Waiting'

✅ 2. When Seats Are Unavailable → Add Passengers as Waiting

In your InsertPassenger method, add logic:

csharp
string status = (availableSeats >= 1) ? "Confirmed" : "Waiting";

// Insert into PassengerBookings
cmd = new SqlCommand(@"INSERT INTO PassengerBookings (BookingID, UserName, TrainID, TravelDate, Class,
                        PassengerName, Age, Gender, Status)
                        VALUES (@bid, @uname, @tid, @date, @class, @pname, @age, @gender, @status)", con);

✅ 3. On Cancellation → Promote Waiting List

In your cancellation logic, after increasing available seats:

csharp
public static void PromoteFromWaitingList(int trainId, DateTime date, string travelClass)
{
    int seats = GetAvailableSeats(trainId, date, travelClass);

    if (seats == 0) return;

    // Fetch waiting passengers in the order they were added
    SqlCommand cmd = new SqlCommand(@"
        SELECT TOP (@seats) PassengerID
        FROM PassengerBookings
        WHERE TrainID = @tid AND TravelDate = @date AND Class = @class AND Status = 'Waiting'
        ORDER BY BookingTime", con);

    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@tid", trainId);
    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@date", date);
    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@class", travelClass);
    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@seats", seats);

    List<int> promoteList = new List<int>();
    SqlDataReader reader = cmd.ExecuteReader();

    while (reader.Read())
        promoteList.Add(Convert.ToInt32(reader["PassengerID"]));

    reader.Close();

    foreach (int pid in promoteList)
    {
        SqlCommand upd = new SqlCommand("UPDATE PassengerBookings SET Status = 'Confirmed' WHERE PassengerID = @pid", con);
        upd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@pid", pid);
        upd.ExecuteNonQuery();

        UpdateSeatCount(trainId, date, travelClass, -1);
    }

    Console.WriteLine($"{promoteList.Count} passenger(s) promoted from waiting list.");
}

✅ 4. When User Logs In → View Bookings with Status

csharp
public static void ViewMyBookings(string userName)
{
    Console.WriteLine("---- Your Bookings ----");

    SqlCommand cmd = new SqlCommand(@"
        SELECT PassengerName, Age, Gender, TrainID, TravelDate, Class, Status
        FROM PassengerBookings
        WHERE UserName = @uname", con);

    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@uname", userName);

    SqlDataReader dr = cmd.ExecuteReader();

    if (!dr.HasRows)
    {
        Console.WriteLine("You have no bookings.");
        dr.Close();
        return;
    }

    Console.WriteLine("Name\tAge\tGender\tTrainID\tDate\t\tClass\t\tStatus");
    while (dr.Read())
    {
        Console.WriteLine($"{dr["PassengerName"]}\t{dr["Age"]}\t{dr["Gender"]}\t{dr["TrainID"]}\t{Convert.ToDateTime(dr["TravelDate"]).ToShortDateString()}\t{dr["Class"]}\t{dr["Status"]}");
    }
    dr.Close();
}

ChatGPT said:

Got it! Your cancellation & waiting list promotion logic is more nuanced — the system must:

  • Promote waiting users in order of booking,

  • But only if their requested ticket count ≤ the number of cancelled/free seats,

  • Otherwise skip to the next waiting user whose ticket count fits the available seats,

  • Continue until all free seats are allocated or no suitable waiting users remain.

Here’s a clearer step-by-step flow for Waitlist Promotion After Cancellation:

  1. User cancels N tickets → N seats become free.

  2. Get waiting list users sorted by booking time.

  3. For each waiting user in order:

    • Check how many tickets they are waiting for.

    • If waiting_user_tickets <= free_seats:

      • Promote all of their tickets to confirmed.

      • Reduce free_seats by waiting_user_tickets.

    • Else:

      • Skip this user (don't split their booking).

  4. Stop when:

    • No more free seats remain or

    • No waiting user fits into remaining free seats.

How to implement this in SQL + C# logic?

Step 1: Get Waiting Users & Their Ticket Counts

sql
SELECT BookingID, COUNT(*) AS WaitingTickets
FROM PassengerBookings
WHERE TrainID = @trainId AND TravelDate = @travelDate AND Class = @class AND Status = 'Waiting'
GROUP BY BookingID
ORDER BY MIN(BookingTime)  -- earliest bookings first

Step 2: C# Logic to Promote Waiting Users

csharp
void PromoteWaitingUsers(int trainId, DateTime travelDate, string travelClass, int freeSeats)
{
    var waitingUsers = GetWaitingUsersWithTicketCount(trainId, travelDate, travelClass);

    foreach (var user in waitingUsers)
    {
        int ticketsNeeded = user.WaitingTickets;

        if (ticketsNeeded <= freeSeats)
        {
            // Promote all tickets for this booking
            PromoteTickets(user.BookingID);

            freeSeats -= ticketsNeeded;
            if (freeSeats == 0) break;
        }
        else
        {
            // Skip user if not enough seats for all their tickets
            continue;
        }
    }
}

Step 3: PromoteTickets Function

csharp
void PromoteTickets(int bookingId)
{
    string query = @"
        UPDATE PassengerBookings
        SET Status = 'Confirmed'
        WHERE BookingID = @bookingId AND Status = 'Waiting'";

    // Execute this query with param bookingId
}

Step 4: Update Seat Availability

When promoting tickets, reduce available seats accordingly.

Great! Here's a complete solution incorporating your cancellation + waitlist promotion logic into your existing Railway reservation system.

1. SQL Stored Procedure to Get Waiting Bookings with Ticket Counts

sql
CREATE OR ALTER PROCEDURE sp_get_waiting_bookings
    @TrainID INT,
    @TravelDate DATE,
    @Class NVARCHAR(100)
AS
BEGIN
    SELECT BookingID, COUNT(*) AS WaitingTickets, MIN(BookingTime) AS FirstBookingTime
    FROM PassengerBookings
    WHERE TrainID = @TrainID
      AND TravelDate = @TravelDate
      AND Class = @Class
      AND Status = 'Waiting'
    GROUP BY BookingID
    ORDER BY FirstBookingTime ASC
END

2. C# Code to Promote Waiting Users After Cancellation

Add this method to your DataAccess class:

csharp
public static void PromoteWaitingUsers(int trainId, DateTime travelDate, string travelClass, int freeSeats)
{
    if (freeSeats <= 0) return;

    using (SqlConnection con = getConnection())
    {
        // Step 1: Get waiting bookings with ticket count
        SqlCommand cmd = new SqlCommand("sp_get_waiting_bookings", con);
        cmd.CommandType = CommandType.StoredProcedure;
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@TrainID", trainId);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@TravelDate", travelDate);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@Class", travelClass);

        SqlDataReader reader = cmd.ExecuteReader();

        List<(int BookingID, int WaitingTickets)> waitingBookings = new List<(int, int)>();

        while (reader.Read())
        {
            int bookingId = Convert.ToInt32(reader["BookingID"]);
            int tickets = Convert.ToInt32(reader["WaitingTickets"]);
            waitingBookings.Add((bookingId, tickets));
        }
        reader.Close();

        foreach (var booking in waitingBookings)
        {
            if (booking.WaitingTickets <= freeSeats)
            {
                // Promote all tickets for this booking from waiting to confirmed
                SqlCommand updateCmd = new SqlCommand(@"
                    UPDATE PassengerBookings
                    SET Status = 'Confirmed'
                    WHERE BookingID = @BookingID AND Status = 'Waiting'", con);
                updateCmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@BookingID", booking.BookingID);
                int rowsUpdated = updateCmd.ExecuteNonQuery();

                // Decrease freeSeats by the promoted tickets count
                freeSeats -= booking.WaitingTickets;

                // Update seats table to reduce available seats accordingly
                SqlCommand seatUpdateCmd = new SqlCommand(@"
                    UPDATE seats
                    SET AvailableSeats = AvailableSeats - @Tickets
                    WHERE TrainID = @TrainID AND TravelDate = @TravelDate AND Class = @Class", con);
                seatUpdateCmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@Tickets", booking.WaitingTickets);
                seatUpdateCmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@TrainID", trainId);
                seatUpdateCmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@TravelDate", travelDate);
                seatUpdateCmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@Class", travelClass);
                seatUpdateCmd.ExecuteNonQuery();

                if (freeSeats == 0)
                    break; // No more seats available for promotion
            }
            // else skip user whose waiting tickets > freeSeats
        }
    }
}

3. Modify Your Cancellation Logic to Use This

When user cancels tickets:

csharp
public void CancelTickets(int trainId, DateTime travelDate, string travelClass, List<int> passengerIdsToCancel)
{
    using (SqlConnection con = DataAccess.getConnection())
    {
        // 1. Cancel tickets individually by PassengerID
        foreach (int pid in passengerIdsToCancel)
        {
            SqlCommand cancelCmd = new SqlCommand(@"
                DELETE FROM PassengerBookings WHERE PassengerID = @pid", con);
            cancelCmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@pid", pid);
            cancelCmd.ExecuteNonQuery();
        }

        // 2. Increase available seats by number of tickets cancelled
        SqlCommand seatIncCmd = new SqlCommand(@"
            UPDATE seats
            SET AvailableSeats = AvailableSeats + @count
            WHERE TrainID = @trainId AND TravelDate = @travelDate AND Class = @class", con);
        seatIncCmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@count", passengerIdsToCancel.Count);
        seatIncCmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@trainId", trainId);
        seatIncCmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@travelDate", travelDate);
        seatIncCmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@class", travelClass);
        seatIncCmd.ExecuteNonQuery();

        // 3. Promote waiting list users based on freed seats
        int freeSeats = passengerIdsToCancel.Count; // since you increased by same number
        DataAccess.PromoteWaitingUsers(trainId, travelDate, travelClass, freeSeats);
    }
}

4. Notes & Summary

  • Each passenger has their own PassengerID — you can cancel any subset of tickets by their IDs.

  • After cancellation, seats freed up = number of tickets cancelled.

  • PromoteWaitingUsers checks waiting bookings in order, promotes only those whose ticket count ≤ free seats.

  • Promoted tickets' status updated to 'Confirmed' and seat availability reduced accordingly.

  • Users querying their bookings will see updated Status (Confirmed or Waiting).

5. Optional: How to Get Waiting List Tickets Count per Booking in C#

csharp
public static List<(int BookingID, int WaitingTickets)> GetWaitingBookings(int trainId, DateTime travelDate, string travelClass)
{
    List<(int, int)> waitingBookings = new();

    using (SqlConnection con = getConnection())
    {
        SqlCommand cmd = new SqlCommand("sp_get_waiting_bookings", con);
        cmd.CommandType = CommandType.StoredProcedure;
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@TrainID", trainId);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@TravelDate", travelDate);
        cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@Class", travelClass);

        SqlDataReader reader = cmd.ExecuteReader();
        while (reader.Read())
        {
            int bookingId = Convert.ToInt32(reader["BookingID"]);
            int tickets = Convert.ToInt32(reader["WaitingTickets"]);
            waitingBookings.Add((bookingId, tickets));
        }
    }
    return waitingBookings;
}

        // Booking tickets method
        public static bool BookTickets(string userName, int trainId, DateTime travelDate, string travelClass, List<string> passengerNames)
        {
            try
            {
                con = getConnection();

                SqlTransaction transaction = con.BeginTransaction();

                // Step 1: Check available seats
                cmd = new SqlCommand("SELECT AvailableSeats FROM seats WHERE TrainID = @trainId AND TravelDate = @travelDate AND Class = @class", con, transaction);
                cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@trainId", trainId);
                cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@travelDate", travelDate);
                cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@class", travelClass);

                object obj = cmd.ExecuteScalar();
                if (obj == null)
                {
                    Console.WriteLine("Train or class not found.");
                    transaction.Rollback();
                    return false;
                }

                int availableSeats = Convert.ToInt32(obj);
                int requestedSeats = passengerNames.Count;

                // Step 2: Insert Booking master record to get BookingID
                cmd = new SqlCommand("INSERT INTO BookingMaster (UserName, TrainID, TravelDate, Class, BookingTime) OUTPUT INSERTED.BookingID VALUES (@userName, @trainId, @travelDate, @class, GETDATE())", con, transaction);
                cmd.Parameters.Clear();
                cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@userName", userName);
                cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@trainId", trainId);
                cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@travelDate", travelDate);
                cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@class", travelClass);

                int bookingID = (int)cmd.ExecuteScalar();

                // Step 3: Insert individual passenger bookings with status (confirmed or waiting)
                string status = "Waiting";
                if (availableSeats >= requestedSeats)
                {
                    status = "Confirmed";
                }

                for (int i = 0; i < requestedSeats; i++)
                {
                    cmd = new SqlCommand("INSERT INTO PassengerBookings (BookingID, TrainID, TravelDate, Class, PassengerName, Status) VALUES (@bookingID, @trainId, @travelDate, @class, @passengerName, @status)", con, transaction);
                    cmd.Parameters.Clear();
                    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@bookingID", bookingID);
                    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@trainId", trainId);
                    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@travelDate", travelDate);
                    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@class", travelClass);
                    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@passengerName", passengerNames[i]);
                    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@status", status);
                    cmd.ExecuteNonQuery();
                }

                // Step 4: Update seats table if seats confirmed
                if (status == "Confirmed")
                {
                    cmd = new SqlCommand("UPDATE seats SET AvailableSeats = AvailableSeats - @count WHERE TrainID = @trainId AND TravelDate = @travelDate AND Class = @class", con, transaction);
                    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@count", requestedSeats);
                    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@trainId", trainId);
                    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@travelDate", travelDate);
                    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@class", travelClass);
                    cmd.ExecuteNonQuery();
                }

                transaction.Commit();

                Console.WriteLine($"Booking {(status == "Confirmed" ? "confirmed" : "added to waiting list")} for Booking ID: {bookingID}");
                return true;
            }
            catch (Exception ex)
            {
                Console.WriteLine("Error booking tickets: " + ex.Message);
                return false;
            }
            finally
            {
                if (con != null && con.State == ConnectionState.Open)
                    con.Close();
            }
        }

        // Get all bookings of user with passenger names and status
        public static List<BookingDetails> GetUserBookings(string userName)
        {
            List<BookingDetails> bookings = new List<BookingDetails>();

            try
            {
                con = getConnection();

                // First get all booking masters for the user
                cmd = new SqlCommand("SELECT BookingID, TrainID, TravelDate, Class FROM BookingMaster WHERE UserName = @userName ORDER BY BookingID DESC", con);
                cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@userName", userName);

                SqlDataReader dr = cmd.ExecuteReader();

                List<int> bookingIDs = new List<int>();

                while (dr.Read())
                {
                    bookings.Add(new BookingDetails()
                    {
                        BookingID = (int)dr["BookingID"],
                        TrainID = (int)dr["TrainID"],
                        TravelDate = (DateTime)dr["TravelDate"],
                        Class = dr["Class"].ToString(),
                        Passengers = new List<PassengerDetails>()
                    });

                    bookingIDs.Add((int)dr["BookingID"]);
                }
                dr.Close();

                // For each booking, get passengers
                foreach (var booking in bookings)
                {
                    cmd = new SqlCommand("SELECT PassengerName, Status FROM PassengerBookings WHERE BookingID = @bookingID", con);
                    cmd.Parameters.Clear();
                    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@bookingID", booking.BookingID);

                    dr = cmd.ExecuteReader();

                    while (dr.Read())
                    {
                        booking.Passengers.Add(new PassengerDetails()
                        {
                            Name = dr["PassengerName"].ToString(),
                            Status = dr["Status"].ToString()
                        });
                    }
                    dr.Close();
                }
            }
            catch (Exception ex)
            {
                Console.WriteLine("Error fetching bookings: " + ex.Message);
            }
            finally
            {
                if (con != null && con.State == ConnectionState.Open)
                    con.Close();
            }

            return bookings;
        }

        // Cancel user tickets by passenger names and promote waiting users accordingly
        public static bool CancelUserTickets(string userName, int trainId, DateTime travelDate, string travelClass, List<string> passengerNamesToCancel)
        {
            try
            {
                con = getConnection();

                SqlTransaction transaction = con.BeginTransaction();

                // Step 1: Find PassengerIDs for user and passenger names (only for confirmed or waiting)
                string passengerNamesList = string.Join(",", passengerNamesToCancel.ConvertAll(n => "'" + n.Replace("'", "''") + "'"));

                // Find PassengerBooking IDs matching criteria and username (via BookingMaster)
                cmd = new SqlCommand($@"
                    SELECT pb.PassengerID
                    FROM PassengerBookings pb
                    INNER JOIN BookingMaster bm ON pb.BookingID = bm.BookingID
                    WHERE bm.UserName = @userName
                      AND pb.TrainID = @trainId
                      AND pb.TravelDate = @travelDate
                      AND pb.Class = @travelClass
                      AND pb.PassengerName IN ({passengerNamesList})", con, transaction);

                cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@userName", userName);
                cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@trainId", trainId);
                cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@travelDate", travelDate);
                cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@travelClass", travelClass);

                SqlDataReader dr = cmd.ExecuteReader();

                List<int> passengerIDs = new List<int>();
                while (dr.Read())
                {
                    passengerIDs.Add((int)dr["PassengerID"]);
                }
                dr.Close();

                if (passengerIDs.Count == 0)
                {
                    Console.WriteLine("No matching passenger tickets found to cancel.");
                    transaction.Rollback();
                    return false;
                }

                // Step 2: Delete the passenger booking records
                foreach (int pid in passengerIDs)
                {
                    cmd = new SqlCommand("DELETE FROM PassengerBookings WHERE PassengerID = @pid", con, transaction);
                    cmd.Parameters.Clear();
                    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@pid", pid);
                    cmd.ExecuteNonQuery();
                }

                // Step 3: Update seats if those cancelled were confirmed tickets
                // Count how many confirmed tickets cancelled
                cmd = new SqlCommand($@"
                    SELECT COUNT(*) FROM PassengerBookings pb
                    INNER JOIN BookingMaster bm ON pb.BookingID = bm.BookingID
                    WHERE bm.UserName = @userName
                      AND pb.TrainID = @trainId
                      AND pb.TravelDate = @travelDate
                      AND pb.Class = @travelClass
                      AND pb.PassengerID IN ({string.Join(",", passengerIDs)})
                      AND pb.Status = 'Confirmed'", con, transaction);

                cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@userName", userName);
                cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@trainId", trainId);
                cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@travelDate", travelDate);
                cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@travelClass", travelClass);

                int confirmedCancelledCount = (int)cmd.ExecuteScalar();

                if (confirmedCancelledCount > 0)
                {
                    // Update available seats
                    cmd = new SqlCommand("UPDATE seats SET AvailableSeats = AvailableSeats + @count WHERE TrainID = @trainId AND TravelDate = @travelDate AND Class = @travelClass", con, transaction);
                    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@count", confirmedCancelledCount);
                    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@trainId", trainId);
                    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@travelDate", travelDate);
                    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@travelClass", travelClass);
                    cmd.ExecuteNonQuery();

                    // Step 4: Promote waiting list passengers if seats freed up
                    PromoteWaitingList(trainId, travelDate, travelClass, confirmedCancelledCount, con, transaction);
                }

                transaction.Commit();
                return true;
            }
            catch (Exception ex)
            {
                Console.WriteLine("Error cancelling tickets: " + ex.Message);
                return false;
            }
            finally
            {
                if (con != null && con.State == ConnectionState.Open)
                    con.Close();
            }
        }

        // Promote waiting list passengers to confirmed status
        private static void PromoteWaitingList(int trainId, DateTime travelDate, string travelClass, int seatsFreed, SqlConnection con, SqlTransaction transaction)
        {
            if (seatsFreed <= 0)
                return;

            // Get waiting passengers ordered by BookingID (oldest first)
            cmd = new SqlCommand(@"
                SELECT TOP (@limit) PassengerID 
                FROM PassengerBookings 
                WHERE TrainID = @trainId AND TravelDate = @travelDate AND Class = @travelClass AND Status = 'Waiting' 
                ORDER BY BookingID ASC", con, transaction);

            cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@limit", seatsFreed);
            cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@trainId", trainId);
            cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@travelDate", travelDate);
            cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@travelClass", travelClass);

            List<int> promoteList = new List<int>();

            SqlDataReader dr = cmd.ExecuteReader();
            while (dr.Read())
            {
                promoteList.Add((int)dr["PassengerID"]);
            }
            dr.Close();

            if (promoteList.Count == 0)
                return;

            // Update their status to confirmed
            foreach (int pid in promoteList)
            {
                cmd = new SqlCommand("UPDATE PassengerBookings SET Status = 'Confirmed' WHERE PassengerID = @pid", con, transaction);
                cmd.Parameters.Clear();
                cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@pid", pid);
                cmd.ExecuteNonQuery();
            }

            // Update seats table to decrease AvailableSeats accordingly
            cmd = new SqlCommand("UPDATE seats SET AvailableSeats = AvailableSeats - @count WHERE TrainID = @trainId AND TravelDate = @travelDate AND Class = @travelClass", con, transaction);
            cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@count", promoteList.Count);
            cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@trainId", trainId);
            cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@travelDate", travelDate);
            cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@travelClass", travelClass);
            cmd.ExecuteNonQuery();

            Console.WriteLine($"{promoteList.Count} waiting passenger(s) promoted to confirmed.");
        }
    }
}

Database Assumptions

To support the above code, your database should have these tables:

  • users (UserName, Password, Phone, Email)

  • seats (TrainID, TravelDate, Class, AvailableSeats) — keeps track of seats per train/class/date

  • BookingMaster (BookingID [PK], UserName, TrainID, TravelDate, Class, BookingTime)

  • PassengerBookings (PassengerID [PK], BookingID, TrainID, TravelDate, Class, PassengerName, Status)

Key Notes

  • Each booking is stored in BookingMaster (1 per booking) and then multiple passengers in PassengerBookings.

  • The AvailableSeats in the seats table is updated on booking and cancellation.

  • Waiting list passengers are promoted automatically on cancellations.

  • Cancellation accepts multiple passenger names (comma-separated).

  • Passenger statuses are either Confirmed or Waiting.

  • Maximum 6 tickets per booking enforced.

Here’s how I’d redesign and implement this in C# with SQL Server, based on your requirements:

1. Database Table Structure (simplified)

sql
-- Reservation Master for each booking (group)
CREATE TABLE ReservationMaster (
    ReservationID INT IDENTITY PRIMARY KEY,
    UserName NVARCHAR(100),
    TrainID INT,
    TravelDate DATE,
    Class NVARCHAR(50),
    BookingDate DATETIME DEFAULT GETDATE()
);

-- Passenger details per reservation
CREATE TABLE ReservationDetails (
    PassengerID INT IDENTITY PRIMARY KEY,
    ReservationID INT FOREIGN KEY REFERENCES ReservationMaster(ReservationID),
    PassengerName NVARCHAR(100),
    Age INT,
    Gender CHAR(1),  -- 'M'/'F'/etc.
    Fare DECIMAL(10,2),
    Status NVARCHAR(20) -- Confirmed, Waiting
);

-- Waitlist table for waiting passengers (can be similar to ReservationDetails but separate for clarity)
CREATE TABLE Waitlist (
    WaitlistID INT IDENTITY PRIMARY KEY,
    ReservationID INT FOREIGN KEY REFERENCES ReservationMaster(ReservationID),
    PassengerName NVARCHAR(100),
    Age INT,
    Gender CHAR(1),
    Fare DECIMAL(10,2),
    RequestDate DATETIME DEFAULT GETDATE()
);

-- Cancellation table to track cancellations and refunds
CREATE TABLE Cancellation (
    CancellationID INT IDENTITY PRIMARY KEY,
    ReservationID INT FOREIGN KEY REFERENCES ReservationMaster(ReservationID),
    PassengerID INT,
    CancellationDate DATETIME DEFAULT GETDATE(),
    RefundAmount DECIMAL(10,2)
);

class BusinessLogic
{
    // ... existing properties

    public void MakeReservation()
    {
        Console.WriteLine("---- Make Reservation ----");

        Console.Write("Enter Train ID: ");
        int trainId = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());

        Console.Write("Enter Travel Date (yyyy-mm-dd): ");
        DateTime travelDate = DateTime.Parse(Console.ReadLine());

        Console.Write("Enter Class (Sleeper, AC etc.): ");
        string travelClass = Console.ReadLine();

        Console.Write("Number of passengers (max 6): ");
        int count = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());
        if (count < 1 || count > 6)
        {
            Console.WriteLine("You can book 1 to 6 passengers.");
            return;
        }

        List<(string Name, int Age, char Gender)> passengers = new List<(string, int, char)>();

        for (int i = 0; i < count; i++)
        {
            Console.WriteLine($"Passenger #{i + 1}:");
            Console.Write("Name: ");
            string name = Console.ReadLine();

            Console.Write("Age: ");
            int age = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());

            Console.Write("Gender (M/F): ");
            char gender = Console.ReadLine().ToUpper()[0];

            passengers.Add((name, age, gender));
        }

        // Calculate fare for all passengers
        decimal totalFare = DataAccess.CalculateFare(trainId, travelClass, passengers);

        Console.WriteLine($"Total Fare for {count} passengers: {totalFare:C}");

        bool success = DataAccess.BookReservation(UserName, trainId, travelDate, travelClass, passengers, totalFare);

        if(success)
            Console.WriteLine("Booking successful!");
        else
            Console.WriteLine("Booking failed!");

        Console.WriteLine("Press any key to continue...");
        Console.ReadKey();
    }

    public void CancelTickets()
    {
        Console.WriteLine("---- Cancel Ticket(s) ----");

        Console.Write("Enter Reservation ID: ");
        int reservationId = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());

        Console.WriteLine("Enter passenger names to cancel (comma separated):");
        string namesInput = Console.ReadLine();

        if (string.IsNullOrWhiteSpace(namesInput))
        {
            Console.WriteLine("No passenger names entered.");
            return;
        }

        List<string> cancelNames = new List<string>();
        foreach (var n in namesInput.Split(',', StringSplitOptions.RemoveEmptyEntries))
            cancelNames.Add(n.Trim());

        bool cancelled = DataAccess.CancelReservationTickets(reservationId, cancelNames);

        if(cancelled)
            Console.WriteLine("Cancellation processed successfully.");
        else
            Console.WriteLine("Cancellation failed.");

        Console.WriteLine("Press any key to continue...");
        Console.ReadKey();
    }
}

class DataAccess
{
    // Calculate fare: example simplistic method based on age & class
    public static decimal CalculateFare(int trainId, string travelClass, List<(string Name, int Age, char Gender)> passengers)
    {
        // Fetch base fare from DB for trainId & class
        decimal baseFare = GetBaseFare(trainId, travelClass);

        decimal totalFare = 0;
        foreach (var p in passengers)
        {
            decimal fare = baseFare;

            // Example discounts for kids/senior
            if (p.Age < 12) fare *= 0.5m;
            else if (p.Age > 60) fare *= 0.7m;

            totalFare += fare;
        }
        return totalFare;
    }

    private static decimal GetBaseFare(int trainId, string travelClass)
    {
        // dummy fixed fare, replace with actual DB call
        if (travelClass.ToLower() == "ac") return 500;
        else return 300;
    }

    public static bool BookReservation(string userName, int trainId, DateTime travelDate, string travelClass,
        List<(string Name, int Age, char Gender)> passengers, decimal totalFare)
    {
        try
        {
            using (var con = getConnection())
            {
                SqlTransaction transaction = con.BeginTransaction();

                // Insert into ReservationMaster
                var cmd = new SqlCommand("INSERT INTO ReservationMaster (UserName, TrainID, TravelDate, Class) OUTPUT INSERTED.ReservationID VALUES (@uname, @tid, @date, @class)", con, transaction);
                cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@uname", userName);
                cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@tid", trainId);
                cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@date", travelDate);
                cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@class", travelClass);

                int reservationId = (int)cmd.ExecuteScalar();

                // Check available seats from seats table
                cmd = new SqlCommand("SELECT AvailableSeats FROM seats WHERE TrainID=@tid AND TravelDate=@date AND Class=@class", con, transaction);
                cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@tid", trainId);
                cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@date", travelDate);
                cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@class", travelClass);
                int availableSeats = (int)cmd.ExecuteScalar();

                string status = passengers.Count <= availableSeats ? "Confirmed" : "Waiting";

                // Insert passenger details (some confirmed, some waiting)
                foreach (var p in passengers)
                {
                    var cmd2 = new SqlCommand("INSERT INTO ReservationDetails (ReservationID, PassengerName, Age, Gender, Fare, Status) VALUES (@rid, @pname, @age, @gender, @fare, @status)", con, transaction);
                    cmd2.Parameters.AddWithValue("@rid", reservationId);
                    cmd2.Parameters.AddWithValue("@pname", p.Name);
                    cmd2.Parameters.AddWithValue("@age", p.Age);
                    cmd2.Parameters.AddWithValue("@gender", p.Gender);
                    decimal fare = CalculateFare(trainId, travelClass, new List<(string, int, char)> { p }); // fare per passenger
                    cmd2.Parameters.AddWithValue("@fare", fare);
                    cmd2.Parameters.AddWithValue("@status", status);
                    cmd2.ExecuteNonQuery();
                }

                // Update available seats if confirmed
                if (status == "Confirmed")
                {
                    cmd = new SqlCommand("UPDATE seats SET AvailableSeats = AvailableSeats - @count WHERE TrainID = @tid AND TravelDate = @date AND Class = @class", con, transaction);
                    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@count", passengers.Count);
                    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@tid", trainId);
                    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@date", travelDate);
                    cmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@class", travelClass);
                    cmd.ExecuteNonQuery();
                }
                else
                {
                    // Insert into waitlist table if seats not available
                    foreach (var p in passengers)
                    {
                        var cmd3 = new SqlCommand("INSERT INTO Waitlist (ReservationID, PassengerName, Age, Gender, Fare) VALUES (@rid, @pname, @age, @gender, @fare)", con, transaction);
                        cmd3.Parameters.AddWithValue("@rid", reservationId);
                        cmd3.Parameters.AddWithValue("@pname", p.Name);
                        cmd3.Parameters.AddWithValue("@age", p.Age);
                        cmd3.Parameters.AddWithValue("@gender", p.Gender);
                        decimal fare = CalculateFare(trainId, travelClass, new List<(string, int, char)> { p });
                        cmd3.Parameters.AddWithValue("@fare", fare);
                        cmd3.ExecuteNonQuery();
                    }
                }

                transaction.Commit();
                return true;
            }
        }
        catch (Exception ex)
        {
            Console.WriteLine("Error booking reservation: " + ex
You said:
where is the waitlist updation for user 2 we discussed before
ChatGPT said:

To handle the waitlist update and auto-confirmation when tickets are canceled, we need to implement logic after ticket cancellation that:

  1. Tracks how many seats were freed.

  2. Scans the waitlist in order of request (FIFO).

  3. Confirms passengers from the waitlist only if enough freed seats match their group size.

  4. Inserts confirmed users into the ReservationDetails table.

  5. Removes them from the Waitlist.

✅ Here’s a high-level outline for ProcessWaitlist method (to call after cancellations):

csharp
public static void ProcessWaitlist(int trainId, DateTime travelDate, string travelClass, int freedSeats)
{
    using (var con = getConnection())
    {
        SqlTransaction transaction = con.BeginTransaction();

        try
        {
            // Step 1: Get all waitlist reservations ordered by request time
            SqlCommand getWaitlist = new SqlCommand(@"
                SELECT ReservationID, COUNT(*) AS PassengerCount 
                FROM Waitlist 
                WHERE ReservationID IN (
                    SELECT ReservationID FROM ReservationMaster WHERE TrainID = @tid AND TravelDate = @date AND Class = @class
                )
                GROUP BY ReservationID
                ORDER BY MIN(RequestDate)", con, transaction);

            getWaitlist.Parameters.AddWithValue("@tid", trainId);
            getWaitlist.Parameters.AddWithValue("@date", travelDate);
            getWaitlist.Parameters.AddWithValue("@class", travelClass);

            SqlDataReader reader = getWaitlist.ExecuteReader();
            var eligibleReservations = new List<(int ReservationID, int Count)>();

            while (reader.Read())
            {
                eligibleReservations.Add((reader.GetInt32(0), reader.GetInt32(1)));
            }
            reader.Close();

            foreach (var (resId, count) in eligibleReservations)
            {
                if (freedSeats >= count)
                {
                    // Move all passengers from waitlist to confirmed
                    SqlCommand moveCmd = new SqlCommand(@"
                        INSERT INTO ReservationDetails (ReservationID, PassengerName, Age, Gender, Fare, Status)
                        SELECT ReservationID, PassengerName, Age, Gender, Fare, 'Confirmed'
                        FROM Waitlist
                        WHERE ReservationID = @resId;

                        DELETE FROM Waitlist WHERE ReservationID = @resId", con, transaction);

                    moveCmd.Parameters.AddWithValue("@resId", resId);
                    moveCmd.ExecuteNonQuery();

                    // Update available seats
                    SqlCommand updateSeats = new SqlCommand(@"
                        UPDATE seats
                        SET AvailableSeats = AvailableSeats - @cnt
                        WHERE TrainID = @tid AND TravelDate = @date AND Class = @class", con, transaction);

                    updateSeats.Parameters.AddWithValue("@cnt", count);
                    updateSeats.Parameters.AddWithValue("@tid", trainId);
                    updateSeats.Parameters.AddWithValue("@date", travelDate);
                    updateSeats.Parameters.AddWithValue("@class", travelClass);
                    updateSeats.ExecuteNonQuery();

                    freedSeats -= count;
                }
            }

            transaction.Commit();
        }
        catch (Exception ex)
        {
            transaction.Rollback();
            Console.WriteLine("Waitlist processing error: " + ex.Message);
        }
    }
}

csharp
int freedSeats = numberOfCancelledSeats;

🎯 Real-World Behavior Covered:

  • User 2 (requested 1 ticket) gets confirmed before User 3 (2 tickets), if only 1 seat is available.

  • If 3 seats are freed: User 2 (1 ticket) + User 4 (1 ticket) get confirmed, not User 3 (2 tickets), unless 2 or more seats are freed at once.

  • Ensures fairness based on earliest request (FIFO) and group size match.
